episode_title: 802 - The One With The Red Sweater

content.description: The Hotel Lobby, Rachel and Phoebe are at the front desk checking out.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Listen y’know what sir? For the last time, I don’t care what the computer says, we did not take a bag of Mashuga nuts from the mini-bar and we did not watch Dr. Do-Me-A-Little!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! Joey uh, were you in our room last night?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No. (Phoebe grabs the receipt and shows it to Joey who gets mad.) I was told the name of the movie would not appear on the bill!
(Chandler and Monica enter.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi! We’re checking out of the bridal suite.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s right. I’m no longer a bride. I’ll never be a bride again. Now, I’m just someone’s wife!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And I’m the happiest guy in the world! (Monica goes and sits down in a huff.) Oh honey, come on don’t be upset. We still have so much to look forward to!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh yeah, right. (Rolls her eyes.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We got the honeymoon.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s not ‘til Thursday.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The wedding pictures?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: They won’t be ready for weeks.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Not the disposable cameras from the tables.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s true! (Happily) I knew I married you for a reason!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’ll tell you what, I will go get them developed and you can go home.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.
(Joey giggles.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What? What did you take a picture of?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nothing! It was something.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay Ross has the cameras, has he checked out yet?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Are you joking? Check out is not ‘til noon and he has a good (checks her watch) eleven minutes left.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross has never checked out of a room a minute before he had to.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, one time, when we were dating, uh we got a late checkout, he got so excited it was the best sex we ever had. Until y’know, he screamed out Radisson at the end.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, well I’m gonna get Ross, get the cameras, and get them developed. (Joey laughs again.) 32 Joe. You’re 32! (Exits)

content.speaker: Front Desk Clerk
content.text: Here’s a copy of your bill.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh thanks. (Reading the bill) Champagne, strawberries…Oh my God! I can’t believe Chandler ordered porn on our wedding night!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, that’s sad. Mashuga nut?

content.description: Ross’s Hotel Room, he is letting Chandler in.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey. (He sees that Ross is packing all of the hotel toiletries) Soaps? Shampoos? Are you really taking all this stuff?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why not? It’s built into the price of the room.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah but you don’t need—(Picks up something)—What is this?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thread!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Score! Where are the disposable cameras?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What disposable cameras?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The cameras? Remember last night I told you to take them?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No you didn’t.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes! Remember? Right before we cut the cake, I went up to you and I said…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh-oh yeah, you-you came up to me and asked if I could do you a favor, and my Uncle Murray came up to you and handed you a check. And then you said, “Why do they call it a check? Why not a Yugoslavian?” (Chandler laughs.) Yeah, then you did that.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So you don’t have the cameras?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. Sorry man.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So? What? What? They’re gone! Monica’s gonna freak!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I’m sure they’re still somewhere here in the hotel. I’ll-I’ll help you look for them.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Great.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: In-in three minutes.
(Chandler goes into the bathroom, closes the door, and then opens it again right away. Ross looks up and hands him the toilet paper Ross already packed.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Phoebe is entering to see Monica sitting in front of a mound of wedding gifts.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Are you gonna open the presents without Chandler?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! (Pause) But, they’re callin’ out to me! I mean this little guy (Holds up a small one) even crawled up into my lap. Oh come on, Chandler wouldn’t mind if I opened just one present! What do you think it is?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: A little mirror that when you look into it you see yourself as an old woman.
(Monica opens it anyways.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: A tiny salt shaker!!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohhh! My God! For tiny salt!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh wow! Okay. Well that was fun.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Good. Okay, I’m just gonna wait for Chandler to open the rest of them.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Whew. Although y’know, this is part of a salt and pepper set. I mean… I guess y’know it may just count as a half a present. What do you think?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well I guess it’s okay to open one more if it’s part of a set. Y’know, it’s probably this one. (Grabs another small one.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Or this one! (She grabs and starts to open the biggest present.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, how are you feelin’? Any morning sickness?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Shh-shh-shh! The guys don’t know yet do they?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! Joey and Ross don’t know anything and Chandler still thinks that Phoebe’s pregnant.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah that’s right Chandler does still think I’m pregnant. He hasn’t asked me how I’m feeling or offered to carry my bags. Boy, I feel bad for the woman who ends up with him. (Monica looks at her.) After you of course.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Don’t worry I promise that you will only have to be pregnant for a few more hours, ‘cause I’m going to tell the father today.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, is it someone in this building? Is it that tall guy from the first floor?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ew! No!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?! I think he’s cute.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well then you have his baby.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Believe me I’m trying.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow. Y’know it is so weird. I mean, you’re gonna tell this guy today and he has no idea what’s gonna happen.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. You’re just gonna knock on his door and change his life forever. You’re like Ed McMahon except without the big check, or the raw sexual magnetism.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. Uh-huh, I guess it is pretty big news.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Pretty big? It’s huge! God, this guy doesn’t have a clue! He’s just walking down the street thinking, ‘I had sex with Rachel Green. I rock!’ then bam! He’s a father and everything’s different.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well it’s only different if he wants it to be. I mean, I’m not gonna ask him for anything.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. Then he still has this huge decision to make. Now he’s walking around thinking, ‘Do I want to be a dad?’ and then bam!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What was that bam?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t. He got…he-he-he-he’s hit by a bus.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey Joey, what would you do if someone that you slept with told you that she was pregnant?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Who called here? Did she sound blond? Huh? Did-did-did she have an accent? I gotta make a call! (Starts to leave) I shoulda never walked into that Sunglass Hut!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Joey! Joey! No, it’s not you! You didn’t get anybody pregnant!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh. Why would you scare me like that? What the hell is going on? (Pause.) Is somebody pregnant?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah. That’s me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God Pheebs! You’re gonna have a baby?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes. Yes I am. Oh my God, I’m gonna have a baby! (Joey and Phoebe hug.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa, wait a minute. Who’s the father?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You don’t know him. It’s not important. He wants nothing to do with me or the baby. (She sits down like she’s pregnant.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well who is this guy?! Huh? Who is he? ‘Cause I will track him down and kick his ass!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: David Lynn.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: David Lynn! David Lynn! David Lynn!! (Exits)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Who’s David Lynn?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh some guy from my gym. A little annoying.

content.description: The Banquet Room, Chandler is under one of the tables as Ross enters.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Chandler?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! Did you find the cameras?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. Did you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes! And that’s why I’m under the table. Celebrating.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well I checked in the uh, lost and found, I talked to the manager, no-one’s turned them.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well this is great. Y’know, those cameras were the only thing that was gonna cheer Monica up today, she’s really depressed.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Now you guys just got married, why is she so depressed?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All my energy is going into not asking that question. I can’t believe I screwed this up!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m sorry man. (Formally dressed people start to enter.) Here’s a thought. This is the same ballroom. There’s a band. There’s gonna be plenty of dressed up people.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are you suggesting we dance our troubles away?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No-no-no, I’m saying we-we buy more of this (disposable cameras) at the gift shop, throw our tuxes back on, and take a few pictures. All we have to do is make sure not to get anybody else’s faces.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are you serious?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m just thinking about your new bride at home. Okay? Do-do you really want to start your life together by letting her down?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Marriage advice? Really?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m telling you, this looks exactly like your wedding! Aren’t these the same flowers?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know, Monica picked out the flowers.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What about the chairs?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She picked those out too.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How about the place settings?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That was her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What did you do?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I was in charge of the cameras! Gift shop?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hmm. (They head off to the gift shop.)

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is sitting on the couch as Phoebe enters.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! Ooh, did you do it yet?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Not yet.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, well what are you doing here? Are you about to do it? (Gasps) Is it Gunther?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! Phoebe, it’s not Gunther.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thank God, ‘cause that hair on a baby…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe the father is not here okay? I haven’t told him yet and I don’t think I can tell him at all now!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know, let me think. I was walking down the street thinking, ‘I’m gonna tell the father today’ and then bam!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Bus?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, you! Phoebe you freaked me out. You kept saying how huge this all is!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well-well but it is huge.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know, but I was just thinking about how huge this is for me. I didn’t even go to how huge this was going to be for the father.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re thinking about this way too much. Just tell him and get it over with. It’s like, it’s like ripping off this Band-Aid. (On her arm) Quick and painless, watch. (Rips it off.) Oh mother of…See?

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Obsessive Monica has now opened more of the wedding gifts.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh-ooh-ooh! Are we opening presents?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! No! I shouldn’t have even opened these! I mean I—Joey I am out of control!! Joey, you have to do me a favor. No matter what I say, no matter what I do, please do not let me open another present! Okay?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Give me one more.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. (Hands her one.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh good, uh you’re here. Uh Pheebs? Listen uh sit down. I-I got something I want to say.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right. (She sits down like she’s pregnant again.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Umm, now uh… It’s a scary world out there, especially for a single mom. Y’know, now I always thought you and I had a special bond so… (He goes to one knee and pulls out a ring.) Phoebe Buffay, will you marry me?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! Joey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hell yeah! I’ll marry you! (She grabs the ring and puts it on.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You can’t marry him!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey lady, your day’s over! It’s my turn!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why?! Why can’t she marry me?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can and I will! (Kisses him.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: She’s not pregnant. It’s Rachel. Rachel’s the one who’s pregnant.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe I think he would notice if you didn’t have a baby in nine months!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s Joey! (Joey turns and looks at her and she mouths ‘I love you’ to him.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Now I can’t believe it! What? Rachel’s pregnant? (The girls nod yes.) Who’s the father?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We don’t know.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ohh… I wonder if that dude.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: There’s a dude?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Who? Who is it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: About a month ago this guy spent the night with Rachel, I didn’t see who it was but… (He walks out and closes the door.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Was that story over?
(They follow him and meet him in the hall coming out of his apartment carrying a sweater.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The guy left this.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! I know who the father is… (She walks into Monica and Chandler’s.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: People have got to finish their stories!

content.description: The Banquet Room, Ross and Chandler are in their tuxes and have started to fake the pictures.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, excuse me? Could you take a picture of us?

content.speaker: Woman At The Wedding
content.text: Oh! Of course. (Ross and Chandler pose and she takes the picture.)

content.speaker: Man At The Wedding
content.text: Uh, would you take one of us?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uhh… Yeah sure. (Holds the camera up to his face.) Click!

content.speaker: Woman At The Wedding
content.text: It didn’t click.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I heard it. I heard it.

content.speaker: Man At The Wedding
content.text: But there was no flash.

content.speaker: Woman At The Wedding
content.text: Why won’t you take our picture?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah. I’ll take, I’ll take your picture. (He takes the picture with his finger over the lens.)

content.speaker: Man At The Wedding
content.text: Uh, your finger was covering the lens.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Who are you? Ansel Adams?! Get outta here!

content.description: Outside Central Perk, Rachel and Phoebe are about to go inside.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Look, I feel really bad about how I freaked you out before, so I called the father and asked him to meet you here so you can tell him. Go!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? Hey wait a minute! Phoebe, how do you even know who the father is?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I may play the fool at times, but I’m a little more than a pretty blond girl with an ass that won’t quit. (She takes the sweater out of her purse.) I believe this belongs to the father of your baby.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God… Oh, he’s in there right now?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh. Now you can turn around or you can go in there and rip the Band-Aid off. What to you want to do?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, let’s rip!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really? Are you sure?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Phoebe!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, sorry. Yeah. (They go inside to confront the father.)

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Hey Rach.

content.description: The Banquet Room, Ross is taking a picture of a plant, Chandler a fork. The band stops.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why don’t you go up on stage. I’ll get a picture of you doing the speech.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. Okay!
(He goes up on stage, mimes like he’s giving the speech, and Chandler takes his picture. However, before he gets down everyone starts clinking their glasses for a real speech.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Will the owner of a 1995 Buick LeSabre please see the front desk? Your car is about to be towed.

content.speaker: Anxious Wedding Guest
content.text: That’s my car!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: A ’95 LeSabre?!

content.speaker: Anxious Wedding Guest
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: A green LeSabre?

content.speaker: Anxious Wedding Guest
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m sorry, I meant a blue LeSabre.

content.speaker: Anxious Wedding Guest
content.text: Yes! Green-blue!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well go! Go move it! (He runs off.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, you ready for the last picture?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Get ready to run. (Chandler walks over to the new bride.) Congratulations on your wedding. (He grabs her, kisses her, Ross takes the picture, and they both run out.)

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: So, what’s this about?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rachel has something that she wants to tell you and umm, I believe that this is your red sweater.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: No. (Unzips his coat.) This is my red sweater.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no. Could I get anyone a coffee or…poison? No? Just for me? Okay. (Walks away.)

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: What’s going on Rach?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nothing! Phoebe kinda made a mistake. But y’know you do wear that sweater a lot, are you involved in some kind of dare?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Y’know, I’m actually glad Phoebe called. (He pulls out a stool and Rachel sits down.) I know we broke up because you thought I wasn’t mature enough, but I’ve really grown up and think we should get back together.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, it’s just not the right time.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: It is the right time. (Takes her hand.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: I’m ready for more.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Tag…

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Come on Rach, let’s give it another try.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m having a baby.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Oh. (He drops her hand.)
(Pause)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You can go.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Thank you. (Gets up and hurries out.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Obsessive Monica has finished opening all the presents. She’s ashamed of this, at least, because as someone enters…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know how any of these got opened?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You opened them all?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know! I know! I am a terrible person! I mean, Chandler is never going to trust me with anything ever again!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh hey! You got my parent’s gift! (Holds it up.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah. What is that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I don’t know. I think it does something to salami.
(Phoebe and Rachel enter.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey! How’d it go?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. What-what did Tag say?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Tag is not the father! And Joey knows now?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I do Rach. I do, and I so happy for you. (They hug.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh wow, you didn’t even try to unhook my bra!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So are you ever gonna tell whoever it is?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I will. I’m just not up for it tonight.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Rach listen, no matter what this guy says I want you to know you’re not gonna be alone in this.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m not?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Listen I uh… (He takes her hand.) It’s a scary world out there especially if you’re a single mom. Y’know, I always felt like you and I have this-this special bond. Y’know? So, (gets down on one knee again) Rachel Green will you marry me?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pheebs, give me the ring back!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! Joey, oh you’re so sweet. You’re so-so sweet, honey. But I’m not, I’m not looking for a husband.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I understand.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Now, if you will excuse me I am going to go and lie down. (Exits.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t say that didn’t hurt. But I’ll take you back Joey Tribbiani.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh yeah. Pheebs, listen about that. I only offered…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh! A Salami Buddy!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: There you go!
(Chandler and Ross enter with the new pictures.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We’re back!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Great! We’re hangin’ in the kitchen! (She drags him into the kitchen and turns his back to the living room) Let’s stay in the kitchen!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s picture time.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Now you are going to love these.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Here’s a picture of Ross. (Shows another one.) And that’s me. (Another one.) And that’s me and Ross. (Another one.) Oh-ho, that is a picture of our first kiss as a married couple.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow! That is a great picture!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Eh?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah! Oh and interesting because I found the cameras in one of our bags! (Throws them into his chest.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh, didn’t see that coming.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, so this isn’t a picture of our first, but it is a picture of my first kiss with…with this lady. Which by the look on your face I’m sure you’ll remember. So we don’t need—(Rips the picture)—There’s no need to have this picture. How about I take the real pictures and get them developed right now.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That would be a good idea.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (Sees the living room.) You opened all the presents without me?! I thought we were supposed to do that together!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You kissed another woman!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Call it even?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay! (They high-five and he walks out.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I’m gonna go get these (the floral bouquet he walked in with) in some water.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait you stole those from these people’s wedding?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No-no, I took them from the hotel lobby. Yeah, they think they can charge me for some dirty movie and a bag of Mashuga nuts, they got another think coming. (Starts to leave.) Hey! My sweater! I’ve been looking for this for like a month!
(He exits leaving a stunned Phoebe and Monica.)

content.speaker: Monica and Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God!

content.description: A Street, Ross walks past Tag wearing the same red sweater.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! How you doing?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Good! Good, long time no see.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Like your sweater.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh hey, right back at ya.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Oh, it’s crazy about Rachel huh?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. She—Well, she’s one crazy lady?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: So whose is it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Umm, I don’t some Italian guy. Come on, read your own label. See you later.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Okay.
(They separate.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: He is so weird.
